analysis: The documents all pertain to exemptions from mandatory retirement for government employees. They cite the same legal authority (section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, or Section 8335 of Title 5 of the United States Code) and are signed by the President. The exemptions are granted because the President deems it in the public interest to retain these employees beyond the standard retirement age. The employees hold various positions across different government departments.
title: Extending Service: Exemptions from Mandatory Retirement
